1.「失礼します！| キリカ修道会の方が 来てくださいました！: Excuse me! The Kirika order is here!

5.「はじめまして。| キリカ修道会より まいりました| 僧侶の サンと申します。: I'm San, a monk from the Order of Chiricahua.|My name is San, a priest from the Order of|Kirika.

6.「あっ！ <pc>さん おひさしぶりです。| また あなたに会えると 思っていま: Ah! <pc> Long time no see! I was|hoping to see you again!

7.「ガーディアンのお仕事……ぜひ| 私にも お手伝いさせてくださいね。: I would love to help you with your Guardian|work.

8.「<pc>さんは サンさんとも| お知り合いだったんですか？| 団長ともそうでし: So <pc> was also acquainted with San?|He was with the Commander as well, and he has|a very broad face!

9.「うふふ。サンさんなんて 言いにくいでしょう？| どうか サンと呼んでくださいね: Mmm-hmm. It's hard to say "Mr. San," isn't it?|Please, call me San, ladies and gentlemen.

10.「では プリゼーラのことも| プリゼーラと呼んでくださいね！ サン！: Then you can call Prisera Prisera too! San!

11.「ところで あの……団長？| お客さまに ご挨拶しなくていいのです……？: By the way, um, Commander? Don't you have to|greet the guests...?

14.<center><pipipi_low>孫には 父は死んだと 言い聞かせる！|お: <pipipi_low>I will tell my grandson that his|father is dead! If he has a father like you,|it would be better for him to forget him!

15.「……キリカ修道会のご協力 心から感謝します。| 私は 守護騎士団の 団長を務め:
I would like to thank the Order of Kirika for|their cooperation. I am the head of the|Guardians of the Order. I look forward to|
|working with you.

16.「こちらこそ！ アストルティアを守る| ガーディアンの活動に貢献できて 光栄です: It's my pleasure! I am honored to contribute|to the Guardian's efforts to protect Astoltia.

17.「さっそくですが 地獄の門というものを| 見せていただいて よろしいですか？|: May I take a quick look at the Gate of Hell? I|heard that the seal has been loosened...

19.「セツラン君 <pc>君。| 彼女の案内を お願いできますか？: Mr. Setsuran <pc>. Could you please|show her around?

21.「<pc>。オレは 先に行って| 地獄の門の様子を 見てくるよ。: <pc>. I'll go ahead and check out the|Gate of Hell.

22.「<pc>は サンと一緒に| 後から来て オレに話しかけてくれ。: <pc> come back later with San and|talk to me.

23.「お客さんを 地獄の門へ行かせるのに| 団長が 同行しないなんて……？: How can you send a guest to the Gate of Hell|and not have the Commander go with him?

24.<cs_pchero>が 魔物を倒すと|サンは 地獄の門の調査を 始めた……。: After <cs_pchero> defeated the monster, San|began to investigate the Gate of Hell...

25.「……おふたりは 地獄の門と呼ばれる| この石像の正体を ご存知ですか？: ...Do you two know the identity of this stone|statue called the Gate of Hell?

26.「くわしい話は 知らないなあ。| １０００年前に 魔神族が残した| 呪いの石像だ: I don't know the details of the story, though|I have heard that it is a cursed stone statue|left by a demon tribe a thousand years ago.

27.「そう……アストルティアとは別の| はるか遠き世界から召喚されし まつろわぬ神。: Yes...a god who is summoned from a world far,|far away from Astoltia. They are called the|Demon Gods...

28.「今から １０００年ほど前| この世界に ある魔神族が降り立ちました。| 名を: About a thousand years ago, a race of demons|descended upon this world. His name is|Strezate.

29.「その魔神族は アストルティアを気に入り| 住みつくことにしました。しかし それ: The demons loved Astoltia so much that they|decided to take up residence here. But it was|a nightmare for this world.

30.「ストレザーテは アストルティアの各地に| ふらりと現れては 人々を奴隷のように: Strezate would wander throughout Astoltia,|treating people like slaves and committing all|manner of tyranny.

31.「かの魔神は その身に| 無限の魔力を 有しており……歯向かう者は| みな むご: The demon god had unlimited magical power in|his body and all who defied him met a horrible|death.

32.「魔神族のチカラは あまりに強大。| それでも アストルティアを守るべく| 世界: The power of the demonic gods was too great.|Even so, many brave warriors from around the|world rallied to protect Astoltia.

33.「勇士たちは ウェナ諸島の荒地に| ストレザーテを誘い出し 無限の魔力を有する|:
The brave warriors lured the Strezate to the|wastelands of the Wena Islands to fight|against a visitor from another world with|
|unlimited magical power.

34.「戦いは苛烈を極め 勇士たちの多くが| 命を落としました。そして 彼らの正義の前:
The battle was fierce and many of the brave|warriors lost their lives. And in the face of|their justice, the demigods were finally|
|defeated...

35.「しかし 死の直前 ストレザーテは| 大いなる呪いを 発動し| 己が身を 巨大な: But shortly before his death, Strezate invoked|a great curse and transformed himself into a|gigantic stone statue.

36.「石像は 強力な魔物を 無数に生み出し| それらは 世界中に散らばり 人々を|: The statues created a myriad of powerful|monsters that scattered around the world,|condemning people to a screaming inferno.

37.「しかし 呪いは あまりに強力で| 石像を壊すことも かなわず| 不完全な封印を: But the curse was so powerful that it was|impossible to break the statue, and the best|they could do was to seal it imperfectly.

38.「魔神族の化身たる石像は 地獄の門と名付けられ| この地で 門の監視をになう 勇:
The stone statues, incarnations of the demonic|gods, were named the Gate of Hell, and the|brave warriors who guarded the Gate were|
|called Guardians.

39.「地獄の門が……魔神族の化身！？| じゃあ 門から出てくる魔物も ストレザーテの:
The Gate of Hell... is an incarnation of the|demon tribe? So the monsters that come out of|the gates are made from the infinite magical|
|power of the Strezate?

40.「そう 伝えられています。ストレザーテの| 化身たる門が 無限の魔力を有する以上:
So it is said. Since the gate, which is the|incarnation of Stresate, possesses unlimited|magical power, there is no choice but to|
|continue to seal it...

41.「しかし 長い時の中で 地獄の門は| 魔封のじゅずに対し 耐性を得たようですね。: But over time, the Gates of Hell seem to have|gained resistance to the Sealing Beads. Soon|the seal will be completely ineffective.

42.「そんな！ もし 門が開きっぱなしになって| 無限に 魔物が出てくるようになれば: Oh, no! If the gates are left open and endless|monsters come out, this time Astoltia will be|destroyed!

43.「それが……今なら| なんとか できるかもしれません。: That...we may be able to do something about it|now.

44.「先ほど <cs_pchero>さんが倒した魔物……| あれが 地獄の門から 出:
The monster that defeated|earlier...the moment it came out of the Gate|of Hell, the magic power of the Gate was|
|slightly reduced.

45.「門の魔力が 減った？| 無限の魔力を有しているはずじゃ……？: The gate's magic power has decreased? It's|supposed to have unlimited magic...?

46.「なので……私は こう推測します。| ストレザーテの魔力は 無限と思えるほどに|: So...I guess this is what I think. Stresate's|magical power is so great that it seems|infinite, but it may be finite.

47.「たとえば １０００年前に 門が有していた| 魔力の量を 湖。魔物１匹を生み出す:
For example, the amount of magical power the|gate possessed a thousand years ago is a lake.|Let's say the amount of magical power required|
|to create one monster is a glass of water.

48.「門が開き 魔物を生み出すたびに 湖からは| コップ１杯の水が 失われていき……: Every time the gate opens and creates a|monster, the lake loses a cup of water... and|now there is only a bucket of water left.

49.「なるほど……湖から コップ１杯の水をくんでも| わからないけど バケツからくん:
I see...so you can't tell if you're drinking a|glass of water from a lake, but you can|visibly see how much water you're losing|
|because you're drinking from a bucket.

50.「そうです！ つまり これは……この地を守り| 魔物を倒しつづけてきた ガーディ: That's right! This is the result of a thousand|years of battle by the Guardians who have|protected this land and defeated monsters!

51.「じゃあ 今なら 門の封印が解けても| 出てくる魔物を 全部 倒してしまえば|:
So now, even if the gate is unsealed, if we|defeat all the monsters that come out, we'll|run out of magical power and the gate will|
|disappear?

52.「いえ……それは難しいでしょう。バケツは例えで| 地獄の門には まだ ウェナ諸島:
No...that would be difficult. The bucket is an|analogy, and the Gate of Hell still has enough|magical power left to create a monster that|
|could cover the Wena Islands.

53.「でも 今なら キリカ修道会に伝わる| 秘術によって 地獄の門を この世から|:
But now, through the mystic arts handed down|in the Order of Kirika, we may be able to|erase the Gate of Hell from the world|
|altogether!

54.「ですが 秘術には 準備が必要で……| 少し 時間をくださいませんか？| そうす: But the magic needs some preparation... so|could you give me some time? If you do that,|I'll...!

55.「わかった！| サンは 秘術の準備を 急いでくれ！: Okay, okay, okay! San, get ready for the magic|trick. Hurry up!

56.「とんでもないことになったよな……。| いつ 門の封印が解けるか わからないし|: It's a hell of a mess we're in now... and we|don't know when the gates will be unsealed, so|we have to be more vigilant than ever.

57.「オレは ここで 門の見張りを続ける。| お前は サンが話してくれたことを| 本: I'll stay here and keep guarding the gate. You|go tell the Commander at headquarters what San|told you!
